description: First Home Savings Account (FHSA) synthetic data template. The FHSA is a registered investment account that allows Canadian residents to contribute up to $40,000 (with an annual contribution limit of $8,000) to buy their first home in Canada. Contributions are tax-deductible, and qualifying withdrawals are tax-free.

FHSA_ID.description: Unique identifier for the FHSA account (e.g., FHSA-123456).

AccountHolderName.description: Full name of the FHSA account holder.

AccountHolderDOB.description: Date of birth of the account holder.

SocialInsuranceNumber.description: Social Insurance Number (SIN) of the account holder.

ContributionLimit.description: Annual FHSA contribution limit ($8,000 per year).

CurrentContribution.description: Amount contributed in the current year.

AvailableContributionRoom.description: Remaining contribution room available to the account holder.

TotalBalance.description: Current total balance of the FHSA account.

AccountCreationDate.description: Date when the FHSA account was established.

InvestmentTypes.description: List of investment types held within the FHSA.

TaxDeduction.description: Indicates whether the FHSA contribution is tax-deductible.

ResidencyRequirement.description: Eligibility details: 'Canadian resident, aged 18 or older (19 in some provinces), under 71, and a first-time home buyer in the last four years.'

QualifyingHome.description: Type of home eligible for FHSA withdrawal (e.g., single-family, semi-detached, townhouse, condominium, co-operative housing).

WithdrawalTypes.description: Types of withdrawals from FHSA, either tax-free (qualifying) or taxable (non-qualifying).

WithdrawalTaxStatus.description: Indicates whether the withdrawal is tax-free (qualifying) or taxable (non-qualifying).

CarryForwardContributionRoom.description: Amount of unused FHSA contribution room carried forward to the next year.
